result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua David Vezina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Department of Corrections.

Sentencing on 8-29-16

Per Judge Anderson
#1 - Restitution Request (amended)

2 CASES:  15CF129 & 16CF88.  Defendant Joshua David Vezina in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  Defendant Joshua David Vezina in custody.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk  9:45 a.m.  Per DA - VR - complied.  Atty Harrelson addresses Ct re: PSI.  DA Steffen argument.  10:26 Atty Harrelson argument.  Ex #1 O&R.  10:51 DE addresses ct.  11:15 break until 11:30.  11:50 back on record.  Mr Vezina (dad) addresses ct. 11:57 Ct begins sentence.  Ct finds De qualifies for Challenge Incarceration program and Sub Abuse Program for each count.  

15CF129:  Count 1 - 9 yrs  4 in/5 ES consecutive to counts 5,9,14,21,27 in 16CF88.  Court costs for 1 felony is $269.50.  DNA sample.  DNA surcharge of $250.00.  Sentence Credit 175 days.  Atty Harrelson to submit within 30 days any other sent. credit.

16CF88: Count 1:  withholds sentence.  Probation for 5 years.  consecutive to count 1 in 15CF129 and 16CF88 sentences on other counts.  
Count 5 - 10 yrs  5 in/5 ES, concurrent with counts 9, 14, 21, 27
Count 9 - 10 yrs 5 in/5 ES, concurrent  with counts 5, 14, 21, 27
Count 14 - 10 yrs 5 in/5 ES concurrent with counts, 5,9,21 27
Count 21 - 10 yrs 5 in /5 ES concurrent with counts 27,14,9, 5
Count 27 - 10 yrs 5 in/5 ES concurrent with counts 21,14,9,5

Restitution as set forth in Exhibit #1:
$1,323.00 to Lundgren
$1,134 to Harriman
$1,100 to Chandler
(see page 1 on exhibit #1)
Ct will sign DC30. 

Fine on Count 5 - of $290.60 with DNA sample and surcharge of $250.00  Ct will charge DNA surcharge on all other counts but finds DE indigent and will waive costs associated for samples in all other counts.  Court will waive court costs on all other charges.  Will charge on Count 5 only.

Absolute Sobriety, no illegal substances, follow probation.  Not to contact anyone who engages in illegal drug activity.  No contacts with any of the victims.   Loss of firearm privleges.  Can not vote.  Civil Rights.  If DOC approves DE to write apology letters, DE may do so.  12:48 adj.
Sentencing hearing on August 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.
